title: Calm down, it is just a game.
body:
"Just a game? 5 stages, $2 million cash prize. This isn't game."

So... when did my Gold 2 match become Worlds? I won so I want my $2 million Riot and you can just mail me the 5 stages. I expect an Email by the end of the work week.

Enemy top laner lost his lane so his team raged at him and told us to 'fkg push fkg mid'. We told them to calm down because it is just a game. We all have had players lose. In fact, **every single game has a loser**. Stop getting pissed about it. It will not help them play better. It will not make you more likely to win. Also, it is just a game. I am not saying that because it is okay to be bad or anything. I am saying it because you should not get so mad about someone losing. It is a game. You are not playing Worlds. There is not $2 million on the line. Calm your ass.


EDIT: I feel as if I could have worded my post better as some people are reading it as no one should take the game serious or I am attempting to devalue your experience. That is not what I meant at all. **My entire point is that it is a game and someone doing badly in a game is never a reason to get pissed and rage at them.** That is my point. I play ranked. I want to climb. I want to do better. **I hate losing. But one thing I hate more than losing is seeing a team group up to attack someone that is playing poorly.** I have played matches in which I dominated and I felt bad because I had the honor of reading /all chat hate towards the player I was beating. I have had matches in which I played like trash and got the blunt end of the hate stick.

It sucks. Both being the victim and being a spectator. It is a game and losing in a game is never a valid reason to verbally attack someone.

> Also if you are the type of person who never causes the loss on your team you are more likely to win games from trolls than lose - since 4/5 players on your team could be trolls, and 5/5 players on their team could be trolls.

This is a misconception. You have to assume that at least one person on the enemy team is likely similar to you, and will not troll or afk. This would reduce the chance back to 50%

It's silly to just assume that all 5 people on the opposing team are going to be potential trolls. Even if you go with that assumption, a player would need to play thousands of matches for the variance to balance out. Considering that the average player will only play a few hundred games per season, it's not even worth trying to bring this troll percentage up.

It's the same thing people say about afks, yet I can get 3 afks in a ROW on my own team, and go 30+ games without the opposing team having an afk. How is that balanced in any way? Oh yeah... maybe after my 4000th game it will average out...  Huzzah.

How am I supposed to climb ranked when I get 3 losses in a row that drop me down a rank due to afks? Then I have to fight the system some more to win my next 3-4 games in a row to get promoted again. People are stuck in elo hell because of afks/trolls/feeders. It's a simple fact.

Lets say you have a win ratio of 50% in non-troll/non-afk matches. Which is what Riot expects... correct? Then you have to factor in all the games where you lose due to AFK/Troll/Feeders. So now your win ratio plummets... but does it ever recover? Sure... again... after thousands of games it might balance.

The typical scenario for me is:

1. Finally win my promos, move up a rank.
2. Win/lose a few games... maybe earn a handful of LP along the way
3. Get 3 afks in a row, and then a 4th game with a feeder troll.
4. Drop back down a rank.
5. Rinse and repeat

It is quite literally 1 step forward and 2 steps back.

"This is a misconception. You have to assume that at least one person on the enemy team is likely similar to you, and will not troll or afk. This would reduce the chance back to 50%"

This is a mathematical absolute.  The odds are even more in your favor if you duo queue with someone you know isn't going to troll.  

The reason you're not climbing is 99.99% of the time not because of trolls/afks/feeders whatever.  It's just REALLY hard for people to take responsibility in this game and accept the fact that they just aren't good enough to carry in their current elo.  It's so much easier to blame the other 4 people on your team or if you want to count smurfs, the other 9 people in your game.  

Yes, there are games that are uncarryable.  But if you can't climb out of your elo after a couple hundred games.... it's time to reevaluate if you're really better than your current elo.
